NAME: Taxonomy-aligned activities
Comments/Description: List of eligible and aligned activities under the EU Taxonomy.

NAME: Proportion of turnover
Comments/Description: Proportion of turnover of a given activity against the total turnover of the company.

NAME: Substantial Contribution Criteria
Comments/Description: Proportion of turnover of a given activity that substantially contributes to one of the environmental objectives. While a given activity can Significantly Contribute to multiple environmental objectives, only one of these columns is expected to be populated.

NAME: Climate change mitigation
Comments/Description: Proportion of turnover of a given activity that substantially contributes to the Climate change mitigation objective.

NAME: Climate change adaptation
Comments/Description: Proportion of turnover of a given activity that substantially contributes to the Climate change adaptation objective.

NAME: Water and marine resources
Comments/Description: Proportion of turnover of a given activity that substantially contributes to the Water and marine resources objective.

NAME: Circular economy
Comments/Description: Proportion of turnover of a given activity that substantially contributes to the Circular economy objective.

NAME: Pollution
Comments/Description: Proportion of turnover of a given activity that substantially contributes to the Pollution objective.

NAME: Biodiversity and ecosystems
Comments/Description: Proportion of turnover of a given activity that substantially contributes to the Biodiversity and ecosystems objective.

NAME: KPI (%)
Comments/Description:
The weighted average value of all the investments that are directed at funding, or are associated with taxonomy-aligned economic activities relative to the value of total assets covered by the KPI, with following weights for investments in undertakings per below:
Turnover-based: %
CapEx—based: %

NAME: Turnover-based
Comments/Description: The weighted average value of all the investments that are directed at funding, or are associated with taxonomy-aligned economic activities relative to the value of total assets covered by the KPI, with weights for investments in undertakings per Turnover.

NAME: CapEx-based
Comments/Description: The weighted average value of all the investments that are directed at funding, or are associated with taxonomy-aligned economic activities relative to the value of total assets covered by the KPI, with weights for investments in undertakings per CapEx.

NAME: KPI (monetary amount)

CapEx-based: [monetary amount]

NAME: CapEx-based

Comments/Description: Additional KPI. Fees and commissions income from services other than lending and AuM. Institutions shall disclose forward-looking information for this KPI, including information in terms of targets, together with relevant explanations on the methodology applied.

Comments/Description: Based on the Turnover KPI of the counterparty

NAME: KPI (Counterparty CapEx)

NAME: Assets for the calculation of GAR
Comments/Description:
1. This template shall include information for loans and advances, debt securities and equity instruments in the banking book, towards financial corporates, non-financial corporates (NFC), including SMEs, households (including residential real estate, house renovation loans and motor vehicle loans only) and local governments/municipalities (house financing).

2. The following accounting categories of financial assets should be considered: Financial assets at amortised cost, financial assets at fair value through other comprehensive income, investments in subsidiaries, joint ventures and associates, financial assets designated at fair value through profit or loss and non-trading financial assets mandatorily at fair value through profit or loss, and real estate collaterals obtained by credit institutions by taking possession in exchange in of cancellation of debts.

3. Banks with non-EU subsidiary should provide this information separately for exposures towards non-EU counterparties. For non-EU exposures, while there are additional challenges in terms of absence of common disclosure requirements and methodology, as the EU taxonomy and the NFRD apply only at EU level, given the relevance of these exposures for those credit institutions with non-EU subsidiaries, these institutions should disclose a separate GAR for non-EU exposures, on a best effort basis, in the form of estimates and ranges, using proxies, and explaining the assumptions, caveats and limitations.

4. For motor vehicle loans, institutions shall only include those exposures generated after the date of application of the disclosure.

NAME: GAR sector information
Comments/Description:
1. Credit institutions shall disclose in this tempate information on exposures in the banking book towards those sectors covered by the Taxonomy (NACE sectors 4 levels of detail), using the relevant NACE Codes on the basis of the principal activity of the counterparty.

2. The counterparty NACE sector allocation shall be based exclusively on the nature of the immediate counterparty. The classification of the exposures incurred jointly by more than one obligor shall be done on the basis of the characteristics of the obligor that was the more relevant, or determinant, for the institution to grant the exposure. The distribution of jointly incurred exposures by NACE codes shall be driven by the characteristics of the more relevant or determinant obligor. Institutions shall disclose information by NACE codes with the level of disaggregation required in the template.

NAME: GAR KPI stock
Comments/Description:
1. Institution shall disclose in this template the GAR KPIs on stock of loans calculated based on the data disclosed in template 1, on covered assets, and by applying the formulas proposed in this template.

2. Information on the GAR (green asset ration of 'eligible' activities) shall be accompanied with information on the proportion of total assets covered by the GAR.

3. Credit institutions can, in addition to the information included in this template, show the proportion of assets funding taxonomy relevant sectors that are environmentally sustainable (Taxonomy-aligned). This information would enrich the information on the KPI on environmentally sustainable assets compared to total covered assets.

Art. 8: KPIs of Insurance and Reinsurance Undertakings
Absolute premiums, year t
Comments/Description: Currency. “Premiums” in columns (3) and (4) shall be reported as gross premiums written or, as applicable, turnover relating to non-life insurance or reinsurance activity.

NAME: Proportion of premiums, year t
Comments/Description: %. “Premiums” in columns (3) and (4) shall be reported as gross premiums written or, as applicable, turnover relating to non-life insurance or reinsurance activity.

NAME: Proportion of premiums, year t-1
Comments/Description: %. The information in column (5) shall be reported in disclosures in the year 2024 and thereafter.

NAME: Climate change adaptation
Comments/Description: %. Non-life insurance and reinsurance can only be aligned with Regulation (EU) 2020/852 as activity that enables climate change adaptation. The information reported in column (6) is therefore the same for all insurance and reinsurance undertakings with non-life and/or reinsurance activities.

NAME: DNSH (Do No Significant Harm)
Comments/Description: Y/N

NAME: Climate change mitigation
Comments/Description: Y/N

NAME: Water and marine resources
Comments/Description: Y/N

NAME: Circular economy
Comments/Description: Y/N

NAME: Pollution
Comments/Description: Y/N

NAME: Biodiversity and ecosystems
Comments/Description: Y/N

NAME: Minimum safeguards
Comments/Description: Y/N

NAME: Non-life insurance and reinsurance underwriting Taxonomy-aligned activities (environmentally sustainable)
Of which stemming from reinsurance activity
Comments/Description: Where a reinsurance activities of an undertaking comprises products applying at the level of a portfolio of underlying direct insurance products and the undertaking assesses the compliance of the activity with the technical screening criteria and the do no significant harm criteria for a proportion of the reinsurance activity’s underlying products pursuant to Climate Delegated Act, Annex II, point 10.2, paragraph 2.3 (“pro-rata approach”), the pro-rata approach should be applied consistently for the information reported in all columns of row A.1.2.

NAME: Other activities
Comments/Description: Activities not included in A.1

NAME: KPI (%)
Comments/Description:
The weighted average value of all the investments of insurance or reinsurance undertakings that are directed at funding, or are associated with taxonomy-aligned economic activities relative to the value of total assets covered by the KPI, with following weights for investments in undertakings per below:
Turnover-based: %
CapEx—based: %

NAME: Turnover-based
Comments/Description: The weighted average value of all the investments of insurance or reinsurance undertakings that are directed at funding, or are associated with taxonomy-aligned economic activities relative to the value of total assets covered by the KPI, with weights for investments in undertakings per Turnover.

NAME: CapEx-based
Comments/Description: The weighted average value of all the investments of insurance or reinsurance undertakings that are directed at funding, or are associated with taxonomy-aligned economic activities relative to the value of total assets covered by the KPI, with weights for investments in undertakings per CapEx.

NAME: KPI (monetary amount)
Comments/Description:
The weighted average value of all the investments of insurance or reinsurance undertakings that are directed at funding, or are associated with taxonomy-aligned economic activities, with following weights for investments in undertakings per below:
Turnover-based: [monetary amount]
CapEx-based: [monetary amount]

NAME: Turnover-based
Comments/Description: The weighted average value of all the investments of insurance or reinsurance undertakings that are directed at funding, or are associated with taxonomy-aligned economic activities, with weights for investments in undertakings per Turnover.

NAME: CapEx-based
Comments/Description: The weighted average value of all the investments of insurance or reinsurance undertakings that are directed at funding, or are associated with taxonomy-aligned economic activities, with weights for investments in undertakings per CapEx.

NAME: Coverage ratio (%)
Comments/Description: The percentage of assets covered by the KPI relative to total investments of insurance or reinsurance undertakings (total AuM). Excluding investments in sovereign entities.

NAME: Coverage (monetary amount)
Comments/Description: The monetary value of assets covered by the KPI. Excluding investments in sovereign entities.

NAME: Additional, complementary disclosures: breakdown of denominator of the KPI
Derivatives (%)
Comments/Description: The percentage of derivatives relative to total assets covered by the KPI.

NAME: Derivatives (monetary amount)
Comments/Description: The value in monetary amounts of derivatives.

NAME: Non-NFRD counterparty exposures (%)
Comments/Description:
The proportion of exposures to financial and non-financial undertakings not subject to Articles 19a and 29a of Directive 2013/34/EU over total assets covered by the KPI:
For non-financial undertakings
For financial undertakings

NAME: For non-financial undertakings
Comments/Description: The proportion of exposures to financial and non-financial undertakings not subject to Articles 19a and 29a of Directive 2013/34/EU over total assets covered by the KPI for non-financial undertakings.

NAME: For financial undertakings
Comments/Description: The proportion of exposures to financial and non-financial undertakings not subject to Articles 19a and 29a of Directive 2013/34/EU over total assets covered by the KPI for financial undertakings.

Comments/Description: Value of exposures to financial and non-financial undertakings not subject to Articles 19a and 29a of Directive 2013/34/EU for non-financial undertakings.

NAME: For financial undertakings
Comments/Description: Value of exposures to financial and non-financial undertakings not subject to Articles 19a and 29a of Directive 2013/34/EU for financial undertakings.

NAME: For non-financial undertakings
Comments/Description: The proportion of exposures to financial and non-financial undertakings subject to Articles 19a and 29a of Directive 2013/34/EU over total assets covered by the KPI for non-financial undertakings.

NAME: For financial undertakings
Comments/Description: The proportion of exposures to financial and non-financial undertakings subject to Articles 19a and 29a of Directive 2013/34/EU over total assets covered by the KPI for financial undertakings.

NAME: NFRD counterparty exposures (monetary amount)
Comments/Description:
Value of exposures to financial and non-financial undertakings subject to Articles 19a and 29a of Directive 2013/34/EU:
For non-financial undertakings: [monetary amount]
For financial undertakings: [monetary amount]

NAME: For non-financial undertakings
Comments/Description: Value of exposures to financial and non-financial undertakings subject to Articles 19a and 29a of Directive 2013/34/EU for non-financial undertakings.

NAME: For financial undertakings
Comments/Description: Value of exposures to financial and non-financial undertakings subject to Articles 19a and 29a of Directive 2013/34/EU for financial undertakings.

NAME: Other exposures (%)
Comments/Description: The proportion of exposures to other counterparties over total assets covered by the KPI.

NAME: Other exposures (monetary amount)
Comments/Description: Value of exposures to other counterparties.

NAME: Taxonomy-aligned exposures where investment risk is borne by the policy holders (%)
Comments/Description: The proportion of the insurance or reinsurance undertaking’s investments other than investments held in respect of life insurance contracts where the investment risk is borne by the policy holders, that are directed at funding, or are associated with, Taxonomy-aligned economic activities.

NAME: Taxonomy-aligned exposures where investment risk is borne by the policy holders (monetary amount)
Comments/Description: Value of insurance or reinsurance undertaking’s investments other than investments held in respect of life insurance contracts where the investment risk is borne by the policy holders, that are directed at funding, or are associated with, Taxonomy-aligned economic activities.

NAME: Taxonomy-non-eligible exposures (%)
Comments/Description: The value of all the investments that are funding economic activities that are not taxonomy-eligible relative to the value of total assets covered by the KPI.

NAME: Taxonomy-non-eligible exposures (monetary amount)
Comments/Description: Value of all the investments that are funding economic activities that are not taxonomy-eligible.

NAME: Taxonomy-eligible but not Taxonomy-aligned activities (%)
Comments/Description: The value of all the investments that are funding taxonomy-eligible economic activities, but not taxonomy-aligned relative to the value of total assets covered by the KPI.

NAME: Taxonomy-eligible but not Taxonomy-aligned activities (monetary amount)
Comments/Description: Value of all the investments that are funding Taxonomy-eligible economic activities, but not taxonomy-aligned.

NAME: Additional, complementary disclosures: breakdown of numerator of the KPI
Taxonomy-aligned NFRD counterparty exposures (%)

NAME: Breakdown of the numerator of the KPI per environmental objective
Taxonomy-aligned activities – provided ‘do-no-significant-harm’(DNSH) and social safeguards positive assessment:
(3) The sustainable use and protection of water and marine resources
(4) The transition to a circular economy
(6) The protection and restoration of biodiversity and ecosystems
Qualitative information to support financial undertakings’ explanations and markets’ understanding of the quantitative KPIs:
Contextual information in support of the quantitative indicators including the scope of assets and activities covered by the KPIs, information on data sources and limitation.

Explanations of the nature and objectives of Taxonomy-aligned economic activities and the evolution of the Taxonomy-aligned economic activities over time, starting from the second year of implementation, distinguishing between business-related and methodological and data-related elements.
Description of the compliance with Regulation (EU) 2020/852 in the financial undertaking’s business strategy, product design processes and engagement with clients and counterparties.

For credit institutions that are not required to disclose quantitative information for trading exposures, qualitative information on the alignment of trading portfolios with Regulation (EU) 2020/852, including overall composition, trends observed, objectives and policy.
Additional or complementary information in support of the financial undertaking’s strategies and the weight of the financing of Taxonomy-aligned economic activities in their overall activity.
